com.alexgilleran.icesoap.xpath.elements.impl
Class BaseXPathElement

java.lang.Object
  com.alexgilleran.icesoap.xpath.elements.impl.BaseXPathElement
All Implemented Interfaces:
XPathElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
DoubleSlashXPathElement, SingleSlashXPathElement
public abstract class BaseXPathElement
extends Object
implements XPathElement

Represents base logic that applies to all XPathElement implementations unless overridden. Note that when extending this class, if you add any extra fields it's imperative that you override hashCode and equals, as these are used by the XPathRepository.

Author:
Alex Gilleran

Method Detail

getPreviousElement

public XPathElement getPreviousElement()
Gets the element previous to this one in the XPath expression.

Specified by:
getPreviousElement in interface XPathElement
Returns:
Either an XPath element, or null if this is the first expression.

setPreviousElement

public void setPreviousElement(XPathElement element)

Sets the previous element to this one in the XPath expression. Note that an xpath element will retain the behaviour determined by how many slashes prefix it.

E.g. If I have an XPath //allnode/xpath and set allnode's previous element as /element, the resulting entire XPath will be /element//allnode/xpath.

Note that for relative XPaths, setting a previous element changes it to a standard single-slash XPath element. E.g. if I have a relative xpath allnode/xpath and set allnode's previous element to /element as above, the resulting entire XPath will become /element/allnode/xpath.

Specified by:
setPreviousElement in interface XPathElement

getName

public String getName()
Gets the name of the element. E.g.
  • "/name" returns "name"
  • "//name " returns "name"
  • "name" returns "name"
  • " /@name" returns "name"

    • Specified by:
    getName in interface XPathElement
    Returns:
    The name of the element.

    Returns:

    isFirstElement

    public boolean isFirstElement()
    Determines whether this element is the first in the XPath expression. E.g. in the XPath expression /example/xpath, invoking isFirstElement() on the example element will return true, whereas on the xpath node it will return false.

    Specified by:
    isFirstElement in interface XPathElement
    Returns:
    true if the first element, otherwise false.

    addPredicate

    public void addPredicate(String name,
                         String value)

    Adds a predicate to this XPath element. Currently, any predicates added will act as "and" rather than "or" when matching with another elements.

    e.g. In the XPath expression /xpath/example[@predname="predvalue"], "predname" would be the name passed into this operation, and "predvalue" would be the value.

    Specified by:
    addPredicate in interface XPathElement
    Parameters:
    name - The name of the predicate.
    value - The value for the predicate.

    matches

    public boolean matches(XPathElement otherElement)
    Determines whether the passed element has the same name and the correct value for all specified predicates of this element.

    Specified by:
    matches in interface XPathElement
    Parameters:
    otherElement - Another element to try to match.
    Returns:
    Whether the passed element matches all the information represented by this xpath.
